title: Girl, 15, killed after collision with a lorry
text:
A 15-year-old girl has died and a 14-year-old boy is seriously injured after a crash in Lincolnshire.

The collision, which happened on Station Road in North Hykeham just after 5pm on Wednesday, October 9, involved a lorry and the two teenagers, who were travelling on a bicycle.

The girl was pronounced dead at the scene and the boy, 14, was taken to hospital with serious injuries.

A 15-year-old girl was killed and a 14-year-old boy was left with serious injuries after they were hit by a lorry in North Hykeham just after 5pm yesterday. The pair were riding bicycles at the time of the tragedy

An air ambulance took the boy to hospital where his injuries are not believed to be life threatening

Police say they are not believed to be life-threatening.

Firefighters, paramedics and police attended the incident and the air ambulance landed in the grounds of the Memorial Hall as crews rushed to help.

Police say the tragedy will have a major impact on the local community.

Inspector Ian Richardson of Lincolnshire Police said: 'This devastating incident has not only had a major impact on the families of these teenagers but it has shocked the community.

'It has been difficult for everyone involved and our thoughts are with the families.

'We would ask people not to speculate while investigations continue. If anyone witnessed this incident, they can contact us on 101.'

Newark Road was closed to traffic in the area and remained shut until just before 9pm.

A spokesperson for EMAS said: 'We received a call at 5.10pm yesterday, October 9 to Station Road, North Hykeham, Lincoln to assist with a medical emergency.

'We sent a LIVES First Responder, two paramedics in ambulance cars, a crewed ambulance and the air ambulance.

'We transported one patient to Queen's Medical Centre.'

Police are asking any witnesses to call 101 quoting reference 318 of October 9.
description: The collision, which happened on Station Road in North Hykeham just after 5pm on Wednesday, October 9, involved a lorry and the two teenagers, who were travelling on a bicycle.
